intro: Listrostachys divitiflora, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree has a rounded canopy and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant is also valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
